org.sopra.api.exercises.exercise4

Interface FordFulkerson<V>


  • public interface FordFulkerson<V>
    The Ford-Fulkerson algorithm for computing maximum flows in a flow network.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void augmentPath(java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> path)
      Finds the minimum capacity along the given path and adds the minimum capacity to flow of each edge of the path.
      void findMaxFlow(FlowGraph<V> graph, V start, V target)
      Computes the maximum flow in a flow network graph from source s to target t.
      java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> findPath(V start, V end, ResidualGraph<V> graph)
      Finds the shortest path with remaining capacity using Breadth-First-Search (BFS) on a residual graph graph from start node start to end node end.

    • Method Detail

      • findMaxFlow

        void findMaxFlow(FlowGraph<V> graph,
                 V start,
                 V target)

        Computes the maximum flow in a flow network graph from source s to target t.

        Given a flow network and a pair of nodes s and t, produces a maximum s-t in that network.

        Parameters:
        graph - The FlowGraph representing the flow network. Flows along edges in this graph will be set to max flows.
        start - The source node.
        target - The target node.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any parameter is null.
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If start or target are not nodes in the graph.

      • findPath

        java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> findPath(V start,
                                          V end,
                                          ResidualGraph<V> graph)

        Finds the shortest path with remaining capacity using Breadth-First-Search (BFS) on a residual graph graph from start node start to end node end.

        A path is considered shorter than another path, if the number of edges in that path is lower.

        If a path with remaining capacity along the edges exists, a Deque containing the edges of the path is returned. The edges are ordered depending on their occurrence in the path starting with an edge to end node as first entry, ending with an edge from start node as last entry.

        If no path with remaining capacity along the edges exists null is returned.

        Parameters:
        start - The start node of the path.
        end - The end node of the path.
        graph - The ResidualGraph to search in.
        Returns:
        A path (represented by a Deque) in the graph with ordering depending on occurrence in the path, or null if path with remaining capacity does not exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If at least one of the parameters is null.

      • augmentPath

        void augmentPath(java.util.Deque<ResidualEdge<V>> path)
        Finds the minimum capacity along the given path and adds the minimum capacity to flow of each edge of the path.
        Parameters:
        path - The augmented path (represented by a Deque) where minimum capacity of path is added to flow.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if parameter path is null.
